title: (x) Beautiful Didone on Klas Ernflo rejected book covers - ITC Didi {Stephen}
content:
thanks for any help on this...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031194103im_/http:/typophile.com/files/goya_4461.jpg)
author: BrooklynRob

comments.content: [Two posts](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031194103/http:/typophile.com/node/44421) of the same designer's work within minutes of each other. Was [Klas Ernflo](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031194103/http:/www.klasherbert.com/index.php?/rejected-book-covers/) just featured on a megapopular site?
Is it so difficult to convert images to RGB before uploading?

No, it’s not difficult to convert them. But it is very difficult to become aware of that problem – if you aren’t confronted with it. There are browsers that simply don’t care about CMYK, so how are their users supposed to do so? To detect the colour mode of a web image, I’d have to download it, locate it on my disk, select ‘Information’, and additionally, select ‘Further information’. 4 steps, only for finding out, i.e. without conversion? No dice, Jan, sorry. :-)
